column4: Just a quick question, no need to elaborate. Why is the kernel written in C and not C++?
I dunno, why don't you go ask the kernel.org people?
thanks.. what is the freenode channel for kernel.org?
Kernel.org is the official Linux kernel repository. I don't think you'll get a very nice answer though, but rather get written off as a troll.
hehe.. well if there is no channel supported by kernel.org, what freenode channel discusses the Linux kernel?
why does it have two pound-signs? ##linux ?
What do you need help with?
You'll need to login to edit - and as far as I cant ell, that requires a !launchpad account these days.
I have been able to log to edit a wiki. But I don't know where to type in my solution. I'm looking to contribute something related to the following topics http://paste.ubuntu.com/290415/
Read at the top - it says "Login to Edit" - alternatively "Edit" if you are logged in
yes I have already logged in. I need help on where to contribute. It's related to the three topics I listed. There is probably an #ubuntuwiki channel or something. Like #blenderwiki for blender
I don't think there is one, no.
